title: weird behaviour with cyrillic-named files
body:
i have got running: 
1) owncloud server running on windows 7 + latest php + latest mysql, 
2) windows sync client running on windows 7,  
3) owncloud web interface opened at a client machine (windows 7 + latest firefox).

after i put a cyrillic-named file to a synced directory:

- it uploads ok, but within 30 seconds a baloon tip pops up saying "file removed. xxx.ext has been removed", and the file vanishes from the synced dir as well.
- but i still see this file via the web interface but with a distorted name (accent-rich letters instead of cyrillic ones), and i can download/delete etc. the file from the web interface.
- i see the file in a server storage dir (/owncloud/data/myaccount/files/) with a distorted (accent-rich letters instead of cyrillic ones) name.

after i drop a cyrillic-named file to a web interface using mouse:

- it appears in a web interface with a correct cyrillic filename
- it does not appear in the synced dir, although the detailed sync client's logs reads under "errors" branch: "files: xxx.ext   file count: downloaded".
- i see the file in a server storage dir (/owncloud/data/myaccount/files/) with a distorted in another way (hyphens and numbers instead of cyrillic ones) name.
